Texts.Chs: 野蛮但必要。所以我的合同被接受了，现在我必须等待。他们的敏捷是出了名的。杀手随时都可能出现。也许他们已经这么做了。他们的隐形能力是无与伦比的。这有点令人不安。
Texts.Eng: Barbaric but necessary. So my contract was accepted, and now I have to wait. Helions are known for their promptness. The assassin could be here any day. Maybe they already are. Their stealth capabilities are unrivalled. It's somewhat disconcerting.

Texts.Chs: 在她瞬间意识到的时候，大喙会后悔搅我的局。我告诉氦离子刺客要保证她知道袭击是从哪里来的。我可不是等闲之辈。
Texts.Eng: Larbeaks will regret messing with me, during her split-second realisation. I've told the Helion to ensure she knows where the hit came from. I will not be trifled with.

Texts.Chs: 我的听差回来了。嗯，我的听差“回来了”。谢天谢地，我的同伴们都没有看到我拿着板条箱，或是在处理尸体。当然，我早就预料到了；据我所知氢离子的刺客射杀了信使。这证明了对方是信守承诺的，因为我们知道我们正在派遣一名值得信赖的佣兵让其他人走向毁灭。
Texts.Eng: My manservant returned. Well, my manservant WAS returned. Thankfully, none of my peers saw me take delivery of the crate, or dispose of the remains. I was expecting this, of course; Helions are known to shoot the messenger. It proves that we the clients are committed, knowing we are sending a trusted employee to their doom.
